Tom, Jim, etc.

I refrained on this one, because I figured I didn't
know enough. Glad to hear Tom speak up.

I've seen only a few examples of the early tsuba shape
I thought Jim was referring to..., but this one looked
like an old kendo shinae tsuba to me too. Similar to
ones an old teacher had on tsuba and shinae preserved
in the 'school museum' back when I was in highschool
south of Nagoya in 1989.
    Didn't the old tsuba soft metal, leather and such,
have more of a teardrop shape to their appeture?-not
the fattened out oval shape of leather shinae tsuba's
opening?

Curran
